sub_title: PhD Candidate at ASCA (UvA) - Research on colonial radio archives
summary:
After a philosophy MA at Paris VIII Vincennes-Saint Denis, I am conducting research on music and philosophy at NYU and teaching philosophy at Hunter College (CUNY). My research themes,  are the tension between arts and politics. I focus on questions of emancipation through art and education.

Before my MA, I obtained a Bachelors in Liberal Arts and Sciences from University College Maatrsicht (UCM).
During my time at UCM I developped my interest for arts and culture, particularly in philosophy and sociology. I deepened my knowledge in this field through the research I conducted during my PEERS research project on the Foundation Louis Vuitton in Paris and during my bachelor thesis on the visual productions by the ateliers populaires of the beaux arts of Paris in 1968. My semester abroad in Hong Kong during my Bachelors was an opportunity to broaden my fields of interest in my studies as well as outside of it through my extra-curricular activities. There I developped a better undrestanding of the concrete implications of the theoretical knowledge I had gained during my time at university.
Over the course of my time in Paris, I have gotten involved in associations working with migrant people alongside with conducting research for my Master thesis. 
I graduated with honours from that MA and applied my research, teaching and musical skills as a guide and guard at Voorlinden Museum and freelance musician and researcher for a project led by the Dutch National Opera in 2020.
